item.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong Price Possibly Revealed by GameStop, and It’s Shockingly Low
item.content:encoded:
It has been discovered by eagle-eyed Hollow Knight fans that Silksong has been listed on GameStop on Nintendo Switch for just $19.99. This price has prompted many to believe it’s a ‘simply a placeholder’ because they can’t understand why Team Cherry isn’t charging more for one of the most anticipated games of 2025.

It’s worth stressing that users have reportedly tried to check out with Hollow Knight: Silksong in their basket at that price, but it ‘does not go through.’

Is Hollow Knight: Silksong Just $19.99?

In a post that surfaced on the Hollow Knight subreddit, it was revealed that GameStop has priced the upcoming title at just $19.99.

When Hollow Knight was released way back in 2017, it came with a price tag of just $14.99, but it was a brand-new title from a remarkably small team. It was said that Team Cherry wanted to make the game accessible to more players, which is still a theme prevalent among some small studios today.

The lowest price Hollow Knight dropped to is around $5.99.

On Reddit, users started debating the price, with some being bewildered that Team Cherry isn’t pushing the popularity of the game to charge more. One user wrote, ‘I was ready to pay 40 bucks. Am I crazy? I’m not even as big a fan as you guys, but it’s been the going rate for quality games, especially if they’re a sequel to a well-loved one.’

Many stressed that Team Cherry doesn’t need to charge more because ‘they are really rich because of Hollow Knight.’

Another user pointed out how the price is potentially harmful to subscription services:

Wild if true.

At that price there’s basically zero reason to play it on Game Pass unless you already have it. PC Game Pass is $12 a month, Xbox is $15. A few more $ to keep the game for life is a no brainer honestly.

Hollow Knight: Silksong will be released on September 4 after years of painstaking waiting. Are you going to pick it up, whatever the price is? Let me know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Paramount wants a Call of Duty movie

item.title: Predecessor 1.8 Update Adds World Shift Mechanic and A New Hero
item.content:encoded:
Predecessor is getting it’s next big update next week. Developer Omeda Studios has announced that version 1.8 of the free-to-play MOBA will go live on September 2nd. The update introduces a new map mechanic called World Shift and adds a highly anticipated hero, Demon King Akeron.

World Shift is a mechanic that changes the battlefield in real time. During a match, paths, objectives, and environmental hazards can appear or disappear, keeping teams on their toes.

“This isn’t just a visual upgrade,” Omeda says. “The World Shift reshapes strategy on the fly, demanding swift adaptation and tight teamwork.”

Aside from the new mechanic, Akeron joins Predecessor as a tank/off-lane/jungle hero with a playstyle all his own. He can climb walls to strike from above and focuses on controlling areas while staying strong in extended fights. Players can tweak his passive, ultimate, and movement abilities to suit different strategies. Akeron is part of the ongoing Ashes of the Damned storyline, bringing the next chapter of the game’s story to life.

While those are the two major additions, Predecessor Version 1.8 also sees the launch of a new ranked season, battlepass updates, and even the launch in a new location: Japan. With the launch of the game in Japan, players will have a dedicated Asia server to provide the best connection possible.

Lastly, performance updates for the new with 1.8 include support for Nvidia DLSS with AMD FSR support coming later. Additional changes cover improvements to the in-game store, user interface, and mini-map.

Predecessor’s 1.8 Update launches on September 2nd for all players. Let us know if you plan on checking it out in the comments below.

For more Insider Gaming, read about how much CD Projekt Red has grown as work on The Witcher 4 and Cyberpunk 2 continues to pick up. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: 60+ Developers Join CD Projekt Red for Witcher 4, Cyberpunk 2, and More
item.content:encoded:
As work continues on The Witcher 4 and Cyberpunk 2, CD Projekt Red continues to grow its headcount within the Polish studio. As part of the company’s latest earnings report, it was announced that the studio has 799 employees working on various projects.

CD Projekt Red Added 69 New Employees

Looking at the break down of the numbers, CD Projekt Red hired 69 new employees at the company between April 30 and July 31, 2025. Those new employees were placed across every team and project in development at the studio, including the aforementioned The Witcher 4 and Cyberpunk 2.

The Witcher 4 remains the studio’s primary focus, growing from 422 to 444 developers and maintaining over half of the company’s development resources. Cyberpunk 2’s sequel also saw significant growth from 96 to 116 developers, suggesting accelerated development on the highly anticipated follow-up.

MORE CDPR: Cyberpunk 2077 Sold More Physical Copies On Nintendo Switch 2 Than Digital

Other projects showed modest but consistent growth: Project Sirius increased from 48 to 51 developers, Project Hadar grew from 19 to 22, and “other projects expanded from 14 to 17. The company’s Shared Services team, which supports all projects with functions such as quality assurance, data, localization, and more, increased from 131 to 149 developers.

This overall expansion reflects CD Projekt Red’s commitment to simultaneously developing multiple major titles while strengthening its operational infrastructure.

For more Insider Gaming, read about how the return of EA Sports College Basketball could be in serious jeopardy. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: All Roblox Super Eleven Codes & Rewards—Every August 2025 Active Code
item.content:encoded:
Super Eleven is a soccer game in Roblox. Here are all of the current reward codes for August 2025, along with all of the expired codes.

Super Eleven is an emerging soccer game on Roblox. Just like other games on the Roblox platform, Super Eleven allows players to unlock some freebies by using reward codes, making life on the pitch easier.

Below, we’ll keep a record of each of the active codes, as well as the ones that have expired, so players can keep track of which ones they’ve used.

Every Active Super Eleven Code & Reward in Roblox (August 2025)

All of these codes below are active as of August 2025.

Make sure you grab every reward before the codes expire:

How to Redeem Super Eleven Codes in Roblox

To redeem codes in Super Eleven in Roblox, follow the steps below:

  1. Set up a Super Eleven account and like the game page in Roblox.
  2. Launch Roblox and log in to Super Eleven.
  3. Head to the lobby and click on the ‘Code’ option on the left.
  4. Type in the code you want and press ‘Redeem.

If the code is indeed active, then you’ll receive the reward. Remember, every code can only be used once per player account.

All Roblox Super Eleven Expired Codes

As of August 2025, we can confirm that the codes listed below have all expired.

Sometimes, expired Roblox codes are brought back. So, it’s always worth giving them a try. Some may still work with some accounts where they were never redeemed.

Where to Find New Roblox Super Eleven Codes

If you always want to be able to keep track of all the current codes in the game, then be sure to bookmark this page, as we’ll be sure to keep it updated regularly.

New codes tend to drop first on the official Discord server, so joining that is always a good idea if you’re a committed player and want to be among the first to know.

Do you love the beautiful game simulators in Roblox? Then be sure to check out our Insider Gaming forum, where you can take part in some discussions.

We also have code guides for other soccer-related Roblox games, such as Strika, One Touch, Blue Lock, and Goalbound.
